moves.1. d4: He starts out with my usual move.
moves.2. h4: That I wasn't expecting. I wonder why he did that.
moves.2... Nf6: I usually go for a four knights opening.
moves.3... Bg4: I pin the pawn to the queen.
moves.4. c3: Is this some strategy I haven't heard about? Please comment.
moves.5... Bd6: I develop my bishop so I can castle.
moves.6... c6: I block it with my pawn.
moves.8... Qd7: I forget why I did it.
moves.10... Ne4: I nees my knight in the battle.
moves.11... Qxc6: I take it with my queen.
moves.12... Nxc6: I take back with my knight.
moves.13. h5: He moves his pawn protected by his rook.
moves.13... Bb4+: His only moves are knight or bishop blocks or king moves to the left.
moves.14... Ng3+: I guess I will take his rook freely.
moves.15... Nxh1+: I take his rook with check.
moves.16... Ng3+: I think this should be a draw. At this move I did my longest conditional move ever.
moves.18. Kf1 Ng3+ 19. Kf2 Nh1+ 20. Kf1 Ng3+ 2: Finally he declares a draw. Please rate and comment honestly.
